author: James Masterman
comment: Nice looking watch face on my LG watch R. Still has a few issues such as the tide heights are off by a consistent 0.2m (too low) vs other tide sources. Tide times seem to be consistent.   Wind speeds don't work, never shows more than 3knots.  Swell heights seem reasonable vs other data sources and what I have observed.  I'm using it for locations in Western Australia.  I would like to see the date & day squeezed on to the face somewhere to make it more general purpose.

author: Ken Alden
comment: Works well for a while with my moto 360 (5.1.1) and moto x (kit-kat). But now, like other reports, doesn't update. Would love to see mph on wind, even after setting it on phone. Website should provide detailed description of the watch face items. A few items don't make sense. With it not updating  I'm Uninstalling. Pity.
title: Tons of potential - great start

author: Chris Lewis
comment: It actually Works now so that's a start. It would be nice to have different spots available on one watchface and more settings on the appearance. Also the way all the the surf locations are listed just doesn't make sense they are in alphabetical order rather than by location from North to south.
title: Getting better. Still needs work

author: Bruce Herring
comment: Good start for sure, would be nice if quick press went to a sport report view. Numbers are far too small to read without my glasses so i cant use it in the water, same problem i have with the mission app on nixon mission.

author: Roman Baran
comment: I love this watch face. In fact, I have solely used this watch face for two months. However it is EXTREMELY buggy when trying to set spots. You will try and set a new spot on the face and the words will start flashing and render the app useless. It's extremely annoying and I wish surfline would push some kind of fix.
title: This is great....if it works.

author: Jere Tuominen
comment: On Moto 360 2nd gen when selecting the watch face it crashes immediately "Unfortunately Surfline has stopped". Only 3 spots in Finland. Would be nice to include all Windguru spots!
title: Chrashes immediately. Otherwise great idea!

author: Oliver Kehm
comment: Very good in my opinion. All the issues have been fixed. A bit crowded-looking on the watch, but it has to be to include all the data. Nice design.
title: Nice watch face

author: Timothy Kolgen
comment: Needs to update more often. Unreliable information still need to confirm the data with your phone to make sure it's updated. It would be cool to have the name of the surf spot on the watch face and last time it updated.

author: Stephen Jabaut
comment: I sail and this app is great for quick access to wind speed direction and tidal flow. However I would love if they had more locations. I sail on the Hudson River near manhattan and that isn't included in the list of places. More spots would be a great improvement. Sailors can go anywhere
title: Useful for Sailing too

author: Mark Delfs
comment: I love this concept! However it would be great to be able to turn off certain things that don't work. Like the wind speed. I'd love to see 3 tiny icons showing the next few days weather. The date would be nice. It has potential!
title: Needs more control in preferences

author: Jeff M. Rapolti Jr., PE
comment: Cool idea and nice layout but needs work on maintaining consistency with the current conditions and then pushing updates from phone to watch in a timely manner. Fix this to get a 4-5 star app.

author: Chris Haines
comment: The day/date would be nice, but this really just needs consistent automatic updating of the data. I'd happily pay for this if it worked properly.
title: Could be so good

author: Ted Bryson
comment: Can't set on gear s2
title: Doesn't work with gear s2

author: Marco Paulo
comment: Slow, unresponsive and metric units dont work.
title: Meh

author: Marco Napoleone
comment: Sfortunatamente la spiaggia di sant'Agostino a Gaeta (ita) non funziona,  perciò inutile...  Spero che in futuro sia risolto il problema
title: Idea bella ma...

author: Jared Stilley
comment: No problem
title: Works great

author: Bruce Muir
comment: face constantly crashes until the watch selects another default. was really looking forward t this  :(
title: Crashes and force closes on G Watch R and HTC One

author: Jon Robinson
comment: Any chance of adding automatic changes to nearest surf spot to current location using phone GPS?
title: Seems to be working well on LG r

author: Guillaume Bernos
comment: The thing is we have to be patient, the list of all the spots is taking very long to load ! ;)
title: Work great

author: Christian Göllner
comment: It took a little bit too long to find available spots, but then worked like a charm! Would be cool to have some more customization options.
title: Good start

author: Pete Smith
comment: How do I get the black watch face on the moto360?  updates do seem a little unreliable.
title: Black face on Moto360

author: Derek Nolan
comment: Nice looking face with lots of potential but Not what I'm looking for...my location is not available, tide times not available and data displayed is not accurate. Needs more locations, tide times and predictions to be usable.

author: Mike Flynn
comment: Fixed the not being able to choose location but finally, good face for the beach!

author: Bradley Uffner
comment: Crashes as soon as I set it to the active watch face.
title: Crashes

author: Jeremy Ellison
comment: Watch face updates now. This is my go to face.
title: Fixed!

author: Brian Lockwood
comment: After uninstalling it and reinstalling it, it works fine.  Wish it gave the times for the upcoming high and low tides.
title: Works Now

author: Collin Schroeder
comment: Pretty good except it has no beaches in Valdez, Whittier, Seward, or Anchorage.
title: No beaches in south central alaska

author: Devin Winterbottom
comment: Agreed with Pete. Black face on Moto 360 please.

author: Joseph Silvestro, Jr
comment: One of the cooler watch faces

author: Ken Miller
comment: Fails to load location so nothing more than a watch face at the moment with what seems to be unchanging data!
title: Great idea, shame it doesn't work.

author: Scott Bishop
comment: Cool watch face but drains my battery. Still unusable. Maybe add a setting for how often it updates
title: Watch face now works

author: Nathan D
comment: Watch always shows the same data. Also a little hard to read with the hands of the watch covering some of the stuff.
title: Doesn't update

author: Reece Williams
comment: Just get unable to load on watchface with ok button to press. Uninstalling useless app
title: Since Update doesn't load

author: Ennis Glendon
comment: No matter what breach I select it crashes on my moto 360.
title: Crashes

author: Patrick McGuire
comment: Did not work for soo long, playing with settings and was finally able to get the watch face set
title: Set to feet and worked

author: Marco Machado
comment: Crashes every time
title: Stop working

author: Jesse
comment: A great watchface.  Only two issues (on moto360, 5.0.1): 1. No way to change between metric and imperial units 2. Beaches that I have tried (e.g., Bondi in Sydney, Australia) won't display wind speeds or direction, despite that data being available on the surfline website.  In its current state it is still very nice.
title: Excellent

author: Kevin Moyer
comment: This still deserves 5-stars but its not woking for me right now. Moto 360 and Android 5.0.2. I'm a long boarder and tech need in SoCal. Would love to have the Surfline data I love (and pay for) on my wearable. Please keep working on it...if you actually are :-/ Thanks brah.
title: PLEASE HELP & FIX "Failed to Load Data"

author: Joshua Kalani Saludez
comment: This is the only tide/surf  watchface I've seen for the LG Smartwatch R. I live on the island of O'ahu in Hawai'i, and would love this for fishing and surfing. Fingers crossed for the next update.
title: POTENTIAL (just need to fix "fail")

author: Kevin Wang
comment: Downloaded the app and it won't retrieve any data. All my other apps are working fine, I'm connected to strong WiFi. Confirmed that the issue repeats on my friends phone
title: Failed to fetch data
